thread.title: Hero dog who 'stopped mother from drowning her son' saved from being put down by petition
thread.title_full: Hero dog who 'stopped mother from drowning her son' saved from being put down by petition

author: Peter Walker
title: Hero dog who 'stopped mother from drowning her son' saved from being put down by petition

locations.name: great hall of the people getty

text:
Hero dog who 'stopped mother from drowning her son' saved from being put down by petition 
The petition to save Buddy secured more than 50,000 signatures Monday 6 March 2017 14:56 GMT Click to followThe Independent Online The council are working to micro chip and register the dog before returning it to the owner Twitter 
A pit bull thought to have saved a nine-year-old boy from drowning has been spared death after a petition went viral. 
The dog, named Buddy, is believed to have dragged a nine-year-old boy from the Murray River in Australia as a mother allegedly attempted to drown him and his five-year-old brother. 
But the pet allegedly bit the eldest boy and the mother, and after the confusing melee, was seized by rangers. 
Police have ordered the dog to be returned to its owners after a GoPetition initiative, to rescue him from the threat of being killed, scooped more than 50,000 signatures. Hero dog saves owner from house fire by protecting woman from flames 
“It is likely that the dog was acting in reasonable defence of the nine-year-old boy that was subsequently hospitalised,” said Murray River Council interim general manager Margot Stork, in a statement. 
“The NSW Police have advised council that they will not be seeking an order to destroy this animal. Our Rangers are passionate about animal welfare and we will always work with residents to ensure their pets are registered, micro-chipped, and provide any advice or assistance.” 
Ms Stork also added that the dog has since been micro chipped and that the dog’s owner will work on correctly registering it. 40,000 sign petition for Obama to be next President of France 
The dog is thought to have intervened as a 27-year-old woman, who cannot be named for legal reasons, allegedly tried to drown the nine-year-old in the Murray River in Moama, on the New South Wales-Victoria border late last week. A few days later the youngest boy’s body was found dead. 
The woman has since been charged with murder and attempted murder. 
The grandparents, who had custody of the children for nearly 18-months, have since accused authorities of failing to act since the mother was allegedly released from prison. World news in pictures World news in pictures 1/32 5 March 2017

The maternal grandfather of the two young boys came out in support of the petition to save Buddy, telling The Courier Mail : "I own a similar dog and I know he was trying to save the boys, it's their nature when they are raised with kids. 
“I have one grandson left, because this brave dog took action.” More about:
